de.esoco.process.ui.app

Class UiWebPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.process.param.ParameterWrapper<T,C>
        • de.esoco.process.ui.UiComponent<java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>>,C>
          • de.esoco.process.ui.UiContainer<C>
            • de.esoco.process.ui.UiComposite<UiWebPage>
              • de.esoco.process.ui.app.UiWebPage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class UiWebPage
extends UiComposite<UiWebPage>
    A UI composite that provides the framework to render and manage a web page. The page will typically consist of header, footer, content, and optionally navigation menus which are added by this class in the required order. Menus are added by overriding the methods addTopMenu(Collection) and addSideMenu(Collection).

    By default the component itself is rendered with an inline layout, i.e. it doesn't have a DOM representation and only the mentioned child components are added to the DOM as direct children of the page's parent.

    This component can also be used to manage a full website by replacing or switching the page content depending on the context. Content switching can be achieved by embedding different pages a deck or tab panel, for example.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UiWebPage

        public UiWebPage(UiContainer<?> rParent,
                 java.util.function.Consumer<UiWebPage> fInitPage)
        Creates a new instance for direct usage, i.e. without subclassing. The argument function will be invoked from within the build() method with this instance as the argument after the page structure has been created.
        Parameters:
        rParent - The parent container (typically a root view)
        fInitPage - A function that initializes the page after it's structure has been created

      • UiWebPage

        protected UiWebPage(UiContainer<?> rParent)
        Constructor for subclassing.
        Parameters:
        rParent - The parent container (typically a root view)

    • Method Detail

      • addSideMenu

        public <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> UiNavMenu<E> addSideMenu(java.util.Collection<E> rMenuItems)
        Adds a side navigation menu to this page. The actual menu creation is done by invoking createSideMenu(UiContainer). Because menus depend on other page components this call must be performed after the page structure has been fully created (typically by extending the method buildStructure()).
        Parameters:
        rMenuItems - The menu items to display
        Returns:
        The new top menu

      • addTopMenu

        public <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> UiNavMenu<E> addTopMenu(java.util.Collection<E> rMenuItems)
        Adds a top navigation menu to this page. The actual menu creation is done by invoking createTopMenu(UiContainer). Because menus depend on other page components this call must be performed after the page structure has been fully created (typically by extending the method buildStructure()).
        Parameters:
        rMenuItems - The menu items to display
        Returns:
        The new top menu

      • getSideMenu

        public UiNavMenu<?> getSideMenu()
        Returns the side menu of this page. If no menu has been created by overriding addSideMenu(Collection) this method will return NULL.
        Returns:
        The side menu or NULL for none

      • getTopMenu

        public UiNavMenu<?> getTopMenu()
        Returns the top menu of this page. If no menu has been created by overriding addTopMenu(Collection) this method will return NULL.
        Returns:
        The top menu or NULL for none

      • build

        protected void build()
        Builds and configures the website elements. Subclasses should typically not override this but instead append additional site building code to the buildStructure() method or perform additional initializations (after building) by overridinginitPage().
        Overrides:
        build in class UiContainer<UiWebPage>

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • initPage

        protected void initPage()
        Initializes the page content after it has been created by buildStructure(). The default implementation invokes the initialization function if such has been provided at construction. When subclassing this method can be overridden to replace the super version with the page initialization code. Especially menus should be added here by means of addTopMenu(Collection) and addSideMenu(Collection).
